title: Lyft Driver - Essential Scenarios and Vocabulary
description: Platform-specific communication for Lyft rideshare drivers

platformVocabulary.context: Lyft's version of surge pricing - shown as percentage increase

platformVocabulary.english: Lyft / Lyft XL / Lux / Lux Black
platformVocabulary.spanish: Lyft / Lyft XL / Lux / Lux Black
platformVocabulary.pronunciation: lift / lift ex-el / looks / looks black
platformVocabulary.context: Different service levels - Lux requires premium vehicles
Weekly bonus for completing certain number of rides
Complete 3 rides in a row without declining = bonus
Complete X rides, earn Y bonus

phrases.english: Welcome! I'm [your name]. How's your day going?

greeting.culturalNote: Lyft brand emphasizes friendliness more than Uber. Warm greeting expected

phrases.english: I'm having trouble finding the exact pickup spot. Can you help guide me?
phrases.spanish: Tengo problemas para encontrar el punto exacto de recogida. ¿Puede ayudarme a guiarme?

phrases.english: I see you're at [location]. I'll meet you there in about 2 minutes.
phrases.spanish: Veo que está en [ubicación]. Lo/La encontraré allí en unos 2 minutos.

conversation.lyftStyle: Lyft encourages friendlier, more conversational approach than Uber

phrases.english: First time using Lyft? / Have you used Lyft before?
phrases.spanish: ¿Primera vez usando Lyft? / ¿Ha usado Lyft antes?

phrases.english: Are you from around here or visiting?
phrases.spanish: ¿Es de por aquí o está de visita?
phrases.pronunciation: es deh por ah-KEE oh es-TAH deh vee-SEE-tah

phrases.english: Let me know if you want any recommendations for [restaurants/things to do]
phrases.spanish: Avíseme si quiere recomendaciones de [restaurantes/cosas que hacer]

conversation.readingCues: But always read passenger cues - some prefer quiet. Don't force conversation

phrases.english: I have water and phone chargers if you need them
phrases.spanish: Tengo agua y cargadores de teléfono si los necesita

phrases.english: Feel free to adjust the temperature or music
phrases.spanish: Siéntase libre de ajustar la temperatura o la música

amenities.tipping: Amenities directly correlate with tips on Lyft. Small investment, big return

phrases.english: Thanks so much for riding with me! Have a wonderful [day/evening/weekend]!
phrases.spanish: ¡Muchas gracias por viajar conmigo! ¡Que tenga un excelente [día/tarde/fin de semana]!
phrases.context: Warm, friendly farewell - Lyft brand style

phrases.english: Take care! Watch for traffic on your side.
phrases.spanish: ¡Cuídese! Tenga cuidado con el tráfico de su lado.

subtle.english: If you enjoyed the ride, I really appreciate any consideration!
subtle.spanish: Si disfrutó el viaje, ¡realmente aprecio cualquier consideración!
subtle.context: Gentle tip reminder if service was excellent

tipReminder.note: Lyft allows this more than Uber due to brand culture, but still be tasteful

streakBonus.howItWorks: Complete 3 consecutive rides without declining = bonus (usually $5-15)
strategy: Accept all reasonable requests during streak
Be strategic about when you start streak
Don't start streak if low on gas or near end of shift
3rd ride can be longer distance - you're committed

communication.english: I'm on a streak bonus, so I really appreciate your patience
communication.spanish: Estoy en un bono de racha, así que realmente aprecio su paciencia
communication.context: If you need to explain why you're being extra accommodating

rideChallenge.explanation: Complete 50 rides by Sunday, earn $200 bonus (example)
rideChallenge.strategy: Plan work schedule to hit challenges. Often makes working weekends worth it

lux/luxBlack.requirements: Premium/luxury vehicle, higher standards for cleanliness and service
lux/luxBlack.dress: Professional attire expected (button-up shirt, no t-shirts)

phrases.english: Good [morning/afternoon/evening]. Welcome. May I help you with your bags?
phrases.spanish: Buenos [días/tardes/noches]. Bienvenido/a. ¿Puedo ayudarle con sus maletas?
phrases.context: More formal greeting for luxury service

twoMinuteWarning.feature: Lyft notifies passenger when you're 2 minutes away
twoMinuteWarning.benefit: Usually means passenger is ready when you arrive - less wait time

waitTime.freeWait: 2 minutes free wait time (shorter than Uber's 5 minutes)
waitTime.noShowFee: Can cancel with fee after 5 minutes total wait

phrases.english: I've been waiting for 4 minutes. I'll need to cancel in 1 minute if you're not here.
phrases.spanish: He estado esperando por 4 minutos. Tendré que cancelar en 1 minuto si no está aquí.

accessibility.wheelchairs: Lyft offers wheelchair-accessible vehicles through Lyft WAV (Wheelchair Accessible Vehicles)
accessibility.serviceAnimals: Must accept service animals - it's federal law (not pets, service animals only)

phrases.english: Of course, I'm happy to accommodate your service animal.
phrases.spanish: Por supuesto, con mucho gusto acomodo a su animal de servicio.

primeTime.strategy: Position yourself in areas that typically go Prime Time before they activate
primeTime.hotspots: Airports, business districts during rush hour, entertainment areas weekend nights

bonusStacking.streakDuringChallenge: If you're working on a Ride Challenge, complete Streak bonuses at same time
bonusStacking.primeTimeStreak: Starting streak during Prime Time maximizes earnings
bonusStacking.calculation: Base fare + Prime Time % + Streak Bonus + Ride Challenge progress + Tips

scheduled Rides.benefit: Lyft Scheduled rides often have Prime Time pricing built in
scheduled Rides.reliability: Passengers more likely to be ready on time
scheduled Rides.commitment: Must accept if you schedule yourself for them

friendlyBrand.note: Lyft markets itself as friendlier, more community-oriented than Uber
friendlyBrand.expectation: Passengers expect warmer, more personal service
friendlyBrand.balance: But still professional - friendly doesn't mean overly familiar

fistBump.history: Lyft originally encouraged "fist bumps" at pickup - now optional
fistBump.current: Not required or expected. Only if you and passenger both comfortable

rating System.minimum: 4.8 rating to stay active (higher than Uber's 4.6)
rating System.importance: Lyft passengers can be more critical - service excellence essential
rating System.recovery: If rating drops, focus on friendly service, cleanliness, and safety

app Differences.navigation: Lyft nav can be less accurate than Uber. Many drivers use Google Maps alongside
app Differences.switching: Can run Lyft and Uber simultaneously - turn off one when you accept other's ride

customerIssues.wrongPassenger: Verify name before starting. Wrong passenger = you don't get paid and may be penalized
customerIssues.report: Use in-app reporting for any issues during trip - creates documentation

deactivation.threshold: Rating below 4.8, high cancellation rate, safety issues
deactivation.appeal: Can appeal through Lyft support with documentation
deactivation.prevention: Monitor your metrics weekly, respond quickly to any platform concerns

culturalNotes.note: Lyft passengers often choose platform for "friendlier" experience. Lean into that
culturalNotes.colombianComparison: Lyft style closer to Colombian warmth than Uber's efficiency focus

culturalNotes.note: Lyft emphasizes community over pure transaction. Drivers are 'members' not 'partners'
culturalNotes.colombianComparison: More aligned with Colombian relationship-oriented culture

culturalNotes.note: Streak bonuses can make you feel pressured to accept marginal rides. Know your limits
culturalNotes.colombianComparison: Different from Colombian flexible work pacing
